snippet: A 16th-century depiction of St. Anthony that had been attributed to the workshop of Bosch or a follower is now thought to be by the Dutch master’s hand.
abstract: Bosch Research and Conservation Project determines 16th-century oil work The Temptation of St Anthony at Nelson-Atkins Museum of Art in Kansas City, Mo, was actually painted by Renaissance master Hieronymus Bosch; academics are reviewing report's evidence; discovery is part of project’s six-year endeavor to locate all of Bosch’s works before quincentenary of his death.
lead_paragraph: A 16th-century depiction of St. Anthony that had been attributed to the workshop of Bosch or a follower is now thought to be by the Dutch master’s hand.

headline.main: Hieronymus Bosch Is Credited With Work in Kansas City Museum
headline.print_headline: Upon Closer Review, Credit Goes to Bosch
